answers.answer: Hi!It is difficult to comment without examination whether the itch is due to fungal infection or not. Usually yeast or fungal infection results in a thick curd like discharge. Vaginal itching may also be due to chemical irritants (such as detergents, fabric softeners, feminine sprays, ointments, creams, douches, and contraceptive foams or jellies), drop in estrogen due to hormonal imbalance, pin worms and stress.  Also, vaginitis can be caused by other infections, including bacterial vaginosis.Using Monistat will not help unless it is a fungal/yeast infection. I suggest you first consult a gynecologist. Keep the area dry. Wear cotton panties. Check and see if you can identify any personal care items that could be causing the itch. If yes, stop using them. If you have a family history of diabetes, get this investigated. Please consult your gynecologist without fail. Take care!

question: im 16 and i started feeling itching and burning down there about a month ago, but thought it ws just normal. It continued so i told my mom and she baught me some monistat, but i feel uncomftorable using it. Im a virgin , and i dont use tampons. I checked today and i felt the inner corner and there was maybe three itchy bumps on each side the size of a pen dot. what does this mean , is it something i should worry about, and what should i do? this is the first time i had a yeast infection.
title: yeast infection?
